maml:description.maml:para: Connect to a SQL Server Database Engine and return the server object.
This command connects to a SQL Server Database Engine instance and returns the Server object.

The credentials to use to impersonate a user when connecting to the SQL Server Database Engine instance. If this parameter is left out, then the current user will be used to connect to the SQL Server Database Engine instance using Windows Integrated authentication.
Specifies if encryption should be used.
String containing the SQL Server Database Engine instance to connect to. Default value is 'MSSQLSERVER'.

Specifies which type of logon credential should be used. The valid types are 'WindowsUser' or 'SqlLogin'. Default value is 'WindowsUser' If set to 'WindowsUser' then the it will impersonate using the Windows login specified in the parameter Credential. If set to 'SqlLogin' then it will impersonate using the native SQL login specified in the parameter Credential.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
String containing the host name of the SQL Server to connect to. Default value is the current computer name.
Set the query StatementTimeout in seconds. Default 600 seconds (10 minutes).

The credentials to use to impersonate a user when connecting to the SQL Server Database Engine instance. If this parameter is left out, then the current user will be used to connect to the SQL Server Database Engine instance using Windows Integrated authentication.
Specifies if encryption should be used.
String containing the SQL Server Database Engine instance to connect to. Default value is 'MSSQLSERVER'.

Specifies which type of logon credential should be used. The valid types are 'WindowsUser' or 'SqlLogin'. Default value is 'WindowsUser' If set to 'WindowsUser' then the it will impersonate using the Windows login specified in the parameter Credential. If set to 'SqlLogin' then it will impersonate using the native SQL login specified in the parameter Credential.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
String containing the host name of the SQL Server to connect to. Default value is the current computer name.
Set the query StatementTimeout in seconds. Default 600 seconds (10 minutes).

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the SQL Server Reporting Services or Power BI Report Server setup configuration from the Registry.

Gets the SQL Server Reporting Services and Power BI Report Server setup configuration information from the Registry. This includes information like instance name, installation folder, service name, error dump directory, customer feedback settings, error reporting settings, virtual root, configuration file path, and various version information of the installed Reporting Services instance.
When no InstanceName is specified, it returns configuration information for all installed Reporting Services instances.
Specifies the instance name to return configuration information for. If not specified, configuration information for all Reporting Services and Power BI Report Server instances will be returned.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the instance name to return configuration information for. If not specified, configuration information for all Reporting Services and Power BI Report Server instances will be returned.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a PSCustomObject with the following properties:
- InstanceName: The name of the Reporting Services instance.
- ServiceName: The name of the service.
- ErrorDumpDirectory: The path to the error dump directory.
- CustomerFeedback: Whether customer feedback is enabled.
- EnableErrorReporting: Whether error reporting is enabled.
- ProductVersion: The product version from registry.
- CurrentVersion: The current version from registry.
- VirtualRootServer: The virtual root server value.
- ConfigFilePath: The path to the report server configuration file.
- EditionID: The edition ID of the Reporting Services instance.
- EditionName: The edition name of the Reporting Services instance.
- IsSharePointIntegrated: Whether the instance is SharePoint integrated.
- InstanceId: The instance ID of the Reporting Services instance.

Connects to the default instance and then runs the query to restore the database NorthWinds.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $serverObject = Connect-SqlDscDatabaseEngine Invoke-SqlDscQuery -ServerObject $serverObject -DatabaseName 'master' ` -Query "select * from MyTable where password = 'PlaceholderPa\ssw0rd1' and password = 'placeholder secret passphrase'" ` -RedactText @('PlaceholderPa\sSw0rd1','Placeholder Secret PassPhrase') ` -PassThru -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows how to redact sensitive information in the query when the query string is output as verbose information when the parameter Verbose is used. For it to work the sensitiv information must be known and passed into the parameter RedactText. If any single character is wrong the sensitiv information will not be redacted. The redaction is case-insensitive.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-SqlDscQuery -ServerName Server1 -InstanceName MSSQLSERVER -DatabaseName 'master' ` -Query 'SELECT name FROM sys.databases' -PassThru

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to the default instance and then runs a query to return all the database names in the instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a server audit.
This command creates a server audit on a SQL Server Database Engine instance.

Specifies the filter that should be used on the audit. See \ predicate expression\ (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/create-server-audit-transact-sql)how to write the syntax for the filter.
Specifies the GUID found in the mirrored database. To support scenarios such as database mirroring an audit needs a specific GUID.
Specifies that the audit should be created without any confirmation.
Specifies the log location where the audit should write to. This can be SecurityLog or ApplicationLog.
Specifies the name of the server audit to be added.
Specifies what should happen when writing events to the store fails. This can be 'Continue', 'FailOperation', or 'Shutdown'.
If specified the created audit object will be returned.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the maximum delay before a event is written to the store. When set to low this could impact server performance. When set to high events could be missing when a server crashes.

Specifies that the ServerObject 's audits should be refreshed before creating the audit object. This is helpful when audits could have been modified outside of the ServerObject , for example through T-SQL. But on instances with a large amount of audits it might be better to make sure the ServerObject is recent enough.
Specifies current server connection object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies that the audit should be created without any confirmation.
Specifies the number of files on disk.
Specifies the maximum file size in units by parameter MaximumFileSizeUnit.

maml:description.maml:para: Repairs an existing SQL Server Power BI Report Server installation.
Repairs an existing SQL Server Power BI Report Server installation using the provided setup executable.
Specifies the path where to find the SQL Server installation media. On this path the SQL Server setup executable must be found.
Specifies the product key to use for the repair, e.g. '12345-12345-12345-12345-12345'. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the parameter Edition.
Specifies a free custom edition to use for the repair. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the parameter ProductKey.
Specifies the file path where to write the log files, e.g. 'C:\Logs\Repair.log'. By default log files are created under %TEMP%.
Specifies the folder where to install the product, e.g. 'C:\Program Files\Power BI Report Server'. By default the product is installed under the default installation folder.
PI Report Server: %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Power BI Report Server
Specifies how long to wait for the setup process to finish. Default value is `7200` seconds (2 hours). If the setup process does not finish before this time, an exception will be thrown.

Required parameter to be able to run unattended repair. By specifying this parameter you acknowledge the acceptance of all license terms and notices for the specified features, the terms and notices that the setup executable normally asks for.
Upgrades the edition of the installed product. Requires that either the ProductKey or the Edition parameter is also assigned. By default no edition upgrade is performed.
If specified the command will not ask for confirmation. Same as if Confirm:$false is used.
If specified the command will return the setup process exit code.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Suppresses the restart of the computer after the repair is finished. By default the computer is restarted after the repair is finished.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads SQL Server media from a provided URL and saves the downloaded media file to the specified file path
The Save-SqlDscSqlServerMediaFile function downloads SQL Server media from a provided URL and saves the downloaded media file to the specified file path.
If the URL ends with ".exe", it is treated as an executable that downloads an ISO. If it doesn't, it is treated as a direct link to an ISO.
The function also prints the SHA1 hash of the downloaded file.
The URL of the SQL Server media to download.
The file path where the downloaded media file should be saved.
The file name of the downloaded media file. Defaults to media.iso if not provided.
The language parameter specifies the language of the downloaded iso. This parameter is only used when the provided URL is an executable file. Defaults to 'en-US' if not provided.
Forces the download of the media file even if the file already exists at the specified destination path.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Disables verbose progress output during the download process.
When specified, and the URL points to an executable (.exe), the function will download the executable file without executing it. The file will be saved using the provided FileName parameter.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a server audit.
This command updates and existing server audit on a SQL Server Database Engine instance.

Specifies the filter that should be used on the audit. See \ predicate expression\ (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/create-server-audit-transact-sql)how to write the syntax for the filter.
Specifies the GUID found in the mirrored database. To support scenarios such as database mirroring an audit needs a specific GUID.
Specifies an audit object to update.
Specifies that the audit should be updated without any confirmation.
Specifies the maximum file size in units by parameter MaximumFileSizeUnit. Minimum allowed value is 2 (MB). It also allowed to set the value to 0 which mean unlimited file size.
Specifies the unit that is used for the file size. this can be KB, MB or GB.
Specifies the amount of files on disk before SQL Server starts reusing the files. If not specified then it is set to unlimited.
Specifies what should happen when writing events to the store fails. This can be 'Continue', 'FailOperation', or 'Shutdown'.
If specified the changed audit object will be returned.
Specifies the location where te log files wil be placed.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the maximum delay before a event is written to the store. When set to low this could impact server performance. When set to high events could be missing when a server crashes.

Specifies that the audit object should be refreshed before updating. This is helpful when audits could have been modified outside of the ServerObject , for example through T-SQL. But on instances with a large amount of audits it might be better to make sure the ServerObject is recent enough.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies the maximum file size in units by parameter MaximumFileSizeUnit. Minimum allowed value is 2 (MB). It also allowed to set the value to 0 which mean unlimited file size.
Specifies the unit that is used for the file size. this can be KB, MB or GB.
Specifies the amount of files on disk before SQL Server starts reusing the files. If not specified then it is set to unlimited.
Specifies the name of the server audit to be updated.
Specifies what should happen when writing events to the store fails. This can be 'Continue', 'FailOperation', or 'Shutdown'.
If specified the changed audit object will be returned.
Specifies the location where te log files wil be placed.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies the maximum delay before a event is written to the store. When set to low this could impact server performance. When set to high events could be missing when a server crashes.

Specifies that the audit object should be refreshed before updating. This is helpful when audits could have been modified outside of the ServerObject , for example through T-SQL. But on instances with a large amount of audits it might be better to make sure the ServerObject is recent enough.
Specifies if the needed file space should be reserved. To use this parameter the parameter MaximumFiles must also be used.
Specifies current server connection object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
